SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc31
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc31.model.card

Class PlayableCard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc31.model.card.PlayableCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Card
Direct Known Subclasses:
GoldCard, ResourceCard, StarterCard
public abstract class PlayableCard extends Object implements Card
This class represents a generic card that can be placed on the playArea. It extends Card All PlayableCard must extend this class.

    Field
    Description

    front
    The front side of a Card
    protected boolean
    side
    Side is a boolean parameter that represents which side of the card is active: side = false → back is active side = true → front is active

  • Field Details

    • front

      protected final CardFront front
      The front side of a Card

    • back

      protected final CardBack back
      The back side of a Card

    • side

      protected boolean side
      Side is a boolean parameter that represents which side of the card is active: side = false → back is active side = true → front is active

    • cardColor

      protected final CardColor cardColor
      It represents the color of a card. It must be set by subclasses, and could be set to null. It is final because the color of the card can't change.

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayableCard

      public PlayableCard(CardColor cardColor, CardFront front, CardBack back)
      The constructor of the PlayableCard.

  • Method Details

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Retrieves the score of the card.
      Returns:
      The score of the card. If the front side of the card is active, it returns the score from the front side. Otherwise, it returns 0.

    • getColor

      public CardColor getColor()
      Returns:
      the color of the card

    • checkCorner

      public boolean checkCorner(int corner)
      Check if it's possible to place a card on the corner indicated by the parameter. If side is true call checkCorner on front, otherwise call checkCorner on back.
      Parameters:
      corner - The index (0 to 3) of the corner to be checked.
      Returns:
      True if it is possible to place a card on that corner, false otherwise.

    • coverCorner

      public Resources coverCorner(int corner)
      Sets the corner of the active side to hidden after a card covering it has been placed If side is true call coverCorner on front, otherwise call coverCorner on back.
      Parameters:
      corner - The index (0 to 3) of the corner to be covered.
      Returns:
      The type of resource that has been covered.

    • getCorners

      public List<Resources> getCorners()
      Retrieves the list of resources representing all the corners of the active side of the card.
      Returns:
      A list of Resources objects representing the corners of the card.

    • getResources

      public List<Resources> getResources()
      Returns a list of non-hidden and non-empty resources available in the active side of the card.
      Returns:
      a list of Resources objects representing the available resources

    • getRequirements

      public Map<Resources,Integer> getRequirements()
      Retrieves the requirements of the card only if the card is on front side. If the card is on back side return an empty map.
      Returns:
      A map of Resources and their required quantity.

    • getObjective

      public Objective getObjective()
      Retrieves the objective associated with the card if only card is on front side. If the card is on back side return null.
      Returns:
      The objective of the card.

    • getSide

      public boolean getSide()
      Retrieves the value of the "side" field.
      Specified by:
      getSide in interface Card
      Returns:
      The value of the "side" field. True if the front side of the card is active, false if the back side is active.

    • changeSide

      public void changeSide()
      Changes the active side of the card. If the current side is true, it will change it to false. If the current side is false, it will change it to true.
      Specified by:
      changeSide in interface Card

    • getImage

      public String getImage()
      Retrieves the path of the image associated with the active side of the card.
      Specified by:
      getImage in interface Card
      Returns:
      The path of the image.
